senses.definition: attention deficit disorder
attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
a medical condition in which somebody partly or completely loses their memory

a mental illness causing somebody to control the amount of food they eat in an extreme way that leads to dangerous weight loss, usually because they have an intense fear of gaining weight and believe they are overweight when they are not put on/​gain/​lose
a person who has anorexia
affected by anorexia; connected with anorexia
a drug used to treat the illness depression Antidepressant
used to treat depression

examples.x: antidepressant drugs

senses.definition: the state of feeling nervous or worried that something bad is going to happen

examples.x: acute/intense/deep anxiety
Some hospital patients experience high levels of anxiety.
Waiting for exam results is a time of great anxiety.

senses.definition: a mental illness that causes somebody to worry so much that it has a very negative effect on their daily life

examples.x: Some people are feeling the pressure and suffering from anxiety and depression.
patients with an anxiety disorder

senses.definition: a worry or fear about something

examples.x: If you're worried about your health, share your anxieties with your doctor.

senses.definition: a strong feeling of wanting to do something or of wanting something to happen

examples.x: the candidate’s anxiety to win the vote
A couple of photographers fell over themselves in their anxiety to get a shot of her.
the people’s anxiety for the war to end

senses.definition: a type of psychotherapy in which you are encouraged to express yourself using art materials
a condition, usually beginning in childhood, that makes it difficult for somebody to pay attention and concentrate, and may make it difficult for them to control their behaviour
a way of relaxing and dealing with stress using positive thoughts and mental exercises
a way of helping somebody to lose a bad habit, by making the habit seem to be associated with an effect that is not pleasant
a depressed feeling that some women get after the birth of a baby
a mental illness caused by fighting in a war
body dysmorphic disorder (a mental illness that causes somebody to worry a lot about problems with their appearance which may not exist or which others may not notice)

examples.x: The exact cause of BDD is not known.

senses.definition: affected by or connected with bipolar disorder Bipolar
a mental illness in which somebody has periods of time when they feel extremely depressed and tired and other periods when they feel extremely active and excited with a lot of energy
a mental illness that causes somebody to spend a lot of time worrying about problems with their appearance which may not exist or which others may not notice

examples.x: He was diagnosed with body dysmorphic disorder after struggling with his body image for many years.

senses.definition: a personality disorder in which somebody finds it difficult to control their emotions or form stable relationships with other people and often acts impulsively without thinking about the consequences

examples.x: Borderline personality disorder is considered one of the most severe and troubling personality disorders.
She was suffering from a borderline personality disorder which drove her to alcohol abuse and self-destructive habits.

senses.definition: borderline personality disorder (= a personality disorder in which somebody finds it difficult to control their emotions or form stable relationships with other people and often acts impulsively without thinking about the consequences)
an occasion when a vehicle or machine stops working

examples.x: a breakdown on the motorway
a breakdown recovery service
Most breakdown services give priority to women travelling alone.
The national breakdown organizations are on hand to help motorists 24 hours a day.

senses.definition: a failure of a relationship, discussion or system

examples.x: The only ground for divorce is the irretrievable breakdown of the marriage.
marriage breakdown
There has obviously been a breakdown in communications between the two sides.
The breakdown of the negotiations was not unexpected.
the complete breakdown of law and order

senses.definition: detailed information that you get by studying a set of figures

examples.x: First, let's look at a breakdown of the costs.
Please provide us with a breakdown of expenditure by department.

senses.definition: the process of a substance breaking into the parts of which it is made

examples.x: the breakdown of proteins in the digestive system

senses.definition: a period of serious mental illness in which somebody is unable to deal with normal life

examples.x: It all became too much and he had some sort of breakdown.

senses.definition: a mental illness in which somebody repeatedly eats too much and then forces themselves to vomit put on/​gain/​lose
a condition resulting from a mental illness, especially schizophrenia, in which a person does not move for long periods
a mental illness caused by fighting in a war
to be able to be removed

examples.x: Does this hood come off?
That mark won't come off.

senses.definition: to take place; to happen

examples.x: Did the trip to Rome ever come off?

senses.definition: to be successful; to have the intended effect or result

examples.x: They had wanted it to be a surprise but the plan didn't come off.

senses.definition: to be successful/not successful in a fight, contest, etc.

examples.x: I thought they came off very well in the debate.

senses.definition: a group of buildings of a similar type together in one place building

examples.x: a sports/leisure/shopping complex
an industrial complex (= a site with many factories)
an apartment complex
a housing complex
a complex of buildings covering about 300 square metres

senses.definition: a group of things that are connected

examples.x: This is just one of a whole complex of issues.

senses.definition: a set of beliefs or fears, which may not be conscious, that can make somebody very unhappy or cause a mental illness

examples.x: He suffers from a guilt complex.

senses.definition: a feeling of worry or embarrassment about something that is not necessary or reasonable

examples.x: She has a complex about her big ears.

senses.definition: very sad and without hope

examples.x: You mustn't let yourself get depressed.
She felt very depressed about the future.
He was really depressed at the thought of going into the office.
She was depressed over the recent death of her mother.
I was depressed by our lack of progress.

senses.definition: affected by the medical condition of depression

examples.x: She became severely depressed.
There is medical evidence to show that he is clinically depressed.
She suffers from sleep disturbance and depressed mood.

senses.definition: without enough economic activity or jobs for people

examples.x: They have made little attempt to bring jobs to economically depressed areas.
The shipping trade was badly depressed.

senses.definition: having a lower amount or level than usual

examples.x: depressed prices

senses.definition: a medical condition in which a person feels very sad, anxious and without hope and often has physical symptoms such as being unable to sleep, etc.

examples.x: He was diagnosed as having clinical depression.
She suffered from severe depression after losing her job.

senses.definition: the state of feeling very sad and without hope

examples.x: There was a feeling of gloom and depression in the office when the news of the job cuts was announced.

senses.definition: a period when there is little economic activity and many people are poor or without jobs

examples.x: The country was in the grip of (an) economic depression.
the Great Depression of the 1930s
He grew up during the Great Depression of the 1930s.

senses.definition: a part of a surface that is lower than the parts around it

examples.x: Rainwater collects in shallow depressions on the ground.
From the air, the photos show a shallow depression on the planet's surface.

senses.definition: a weather condition in which the pressure of the air becomes lower, often causing rain

examples.x: an atmospheric depression moving east from the Atlantic

senses.definition: unable to behave and think normally, especially because of a mental illness -ed

examples.x: mentally deranged
a deranged attacker
At first I thought he was deranged.
The plan seemed to be the product of a deranged mind.
Deranged with panic, I ran back and forth.

senses.definition: treatment given to people to help them stop drinking alcohol or taking drugs

examples.x: a detoxification unit

senses.definition: the process of improving the reputation of somebody/something that has been seen as morally bad

examples.x: The policy has been key to the successful detoxification of the party's brand.

senses.definition: the process of removing harmful substances or poisons from something

examples.x: the detoxification of formaldehyde

senses.definition: to remove harmful substances or poisons from something; to become free from harmful substances

examples.x: She recommends bitter greens to cleanse and detoxify the body.
You can help your body detoxify by cutting down on coffee.

senses.definition: to stop drinking too much alcohol or taking drugs; to treat somebody in order to help them do this

examples.x: to detoxify from heroin addiction
He was twice detoxified from heroin.

senses.definition: a drug that is used to make people feel less anxious and more relaxed

dissociative identity disorder (= a mental illness in which somebody feels uncertain about who they are and feels that they have more than one separate identity, each one having its own name, voice, memories, personality, etc.)
showing a lack of order or control

examples.x: disordered hair
a disordered state
He looked round the disordered kitchen.
It is likely that the universe started out in a chaotic and disordered state.

senses.definition: affected by a medical disorder

examples.x: Anorexia or other disordered eating over a long period can cause lasting damage.

senses.definition: a mental illness in which somebody feels uncertain about who they are and feels that they have more than one separate identity, each one having its own name, voice, memories, personality, etc.
a condition in which somebody develops eating habits that are not healthy as a way of dealing with difficult feelings or situations
a condition in which somebody is extremely interested in or concerned about themselves, in a way that is not reasonable
a medical treatment for some serious mental illnesses in which electricity is passed through the patient's brain
a medical treatment for some serious mental illnesses in which electricity is passed through the patient's brain
behaviour that is intended to make people notice or admire you
the mental condition that makes somebody want to show their sexual organs in public
a treatment for mental health problems in which members of a family meet with a therapist in order to address problems within the family

examples.x: The centre offers individual, group and family therapy sessions.

senses.definition: sad or anxious feelings that somebody has because their gender identity does not match the sex they were said to have at birth
a type of psychiatric treatment in which people with similar personal problems meet together to discuss them

examples.x: Group therapy is not as popular as it used to be.

senses.definition: a condition in which somebody worries so much about the possibility that they are ill or may become ill that it badly affects their life

examples.x: A person with health anxiety can misinterpret sensations as a sign of serious disease.
The pandemic has led to rising levels of health anxiety.

senses.definition: a state in which a person, especially a child, is too active and only able to keep quiet and still for short periods
worrying so much that you may be or become ill that it badly affects your life; affected by hypochondria
a person who worries so much that they may be or become ill that it badly affects their life; a person who has hypochondria
a feeling that you are not as good, as important or as intelligent as other people

examples.x: She has always had an inferiority complex about her looks.

senses.definition: the quality or state of being likely to change or fail suddenly

examples.x: political and economic instability

senses.definition: a mental condition in which somebody’s behaviour is likely to change suddenly

examples.x: mental/emotional instability
He showed increasing signs of mental instability.

senses.definition: a mental illness in which somebody has a strong desire, which they cannot control, to steal things -mania
having mental and emotional problems that lead to unacceptable behaviour
bipolar (= affected by or connected with bipolar disorder)
a strong feeling that you want to have more and more power
a mental illness in which somebody has a much greater belief in their own importance or power than is reasonable
connected with or happening in the mind; involving the process of thinking

examples.x: the mental process of remembering
Do you have a mental picture of what it will look like?
The actor doesn't match the mental image I had of the character.
I made a mental note to talk to her about it.
He has a complete mental block (= difficulty in understanding or remembering) when it comes to physics.
These musicians have prodigious mental capacities.
The experience caused her huge amounts of mental suffering.

senses.definition: connected with the state of health of the mind or with the treatment of illnesses of the mind mental

examples.x: a mental illness/disorder
She was suffering from physical and mental exhaustion.
The analysis of dreams can reveal details of a person's mental state.
a mental hospital/patient

senses.definition: crazy

examples.x: My dad will go mental (= be very angry) when he finds out.
We were just losing so much money—it was mental.
It was mental, but a brilliant ending to the film.

senses.definition: the state of health of somebody's mind mad

examples.x: Volunteering can also improve your mental health and help you live longer.
She called for more honest conversations about mental health.
Many of us struggle with our mental health.
It's important to tackle the causes of stress and poor mental health early on.
to have mental health issues/problems
There is often a stigma attached to mental health issues.

senses.definition: the system for treating people with mental health problems

examples.x: The government has announced £600 million extra funding for mental health.
The demand for mental health services rose after the pandemic.

senses.definition: connected with or happening in the mind Mentally

examples.x: mentally ill
The baby is very mentally alert.
Mentally, I began making a list of things I had to do.
I felt extremely fit, both physically and mentally.
You need to be mentally prepared for the race.

senses.definition: remembering somebody/something and considering them or it when you do something

examples.x: mindful of our responsibilities
Mindful of the danger of tropical storms, I decided not to go out.
She is mindful that the election result was very close last time.

senses.definition: concentrating on the present moment, especially as a technique to help you relax

examples.x: practising mindful meditation

senses.definition: the fact of remembering somebody/something and considering them/it when you do something

examples.x: their mindfulness of the wider cinematic tradition

senses.definition: a mental state achieved by concentrating on the present moment, while calmly accepting the feelings and thoughts that come to you, used as a technique to help you relax

examples.x: A therapist may teach mindfulness, a concept borrowed from Zen Buddhism.
Mindfulness is a way for body and mind to reconnect.

senses.definition: too much interest in or enthusiasm for just one thing so that it is not healthy
a sudden change of mood that is difficult to explain

examples.x: Severe disruption of the sleep cycle can lead to depression and mood swings.

senses.definition: a treatment for mental, emotional or physical health problems that involves playing or listening to music

examples.x: Music therapy has proved more effective for me than any other kind of treatment.

senses.definition: a personality disorder in which somebody has an idea of their own importance that is not reasonable, a strong need to be admired by other people, and a lack of understanding of other people's feelings
a period of serious mental illness in which somebody is unable to deal with normal life

examples.x: to have/suffer a nervous breakdown
The stress of her job had brought her to the brink of a nervous breakdown.

senses.definition: a mental health condition in which a person has strong feelings of fear or worry

examples.x: She was a psychoanalyst who developed her own theory of neurosis.

senses.definition: any strong fear or worry

examples.x: the director's neurosis about actors arriving late for filming
This obsession with time is a modern neurosis and one we all have to live with.

senses.definition: not in a normal mental state
a mental illness in which somebody feels they have to repeat certain actions or activities to get rid of fears or unpleasant thoughts
a mental illness in which somebody feels they have to repeat certain actions or activities to get rid of fears or unpleasant thoughts (the abbreviation for ‘obsessive compulsive disorder’)

examples.x: to have OCD

senses.definition: a condition in which somebody is very concerned about eating only foods they believe to be healthy, in a way that is not reasonable

examples.x: A person with orthorexia will be obsessed with defining and maintaining the perfect diet.

senses.definition: the belief that other people dislike or want to harm you, when there is no evidence or reason for this

examples.x: External threats will just fuel paranoia among those in power.
I was full of paranoia that people were talking about me.

senses.definition: false beliefs that are part of a mental illness, especially the belief that people are trying or planning to harm you

examples.x: The drugs can induce paranoia.

senses.definition: believing that other people dislike you or want to harm you, when there is no reason or evidence for this afraid

examples.x: She's getting really paranoid about what other people say about her.
You're just being paranoid.

senses.definition: having false beliefs because of a mental illness, especially the belief that people are trying or planning to harm you

examples.x: paranoid delusions
paranoid schizophrenia
a paranoid schizophrenic

senses.definition: a person who is paranoid
a strong false belief or fear that other people hate you or are trying to harm you

a condition in which somebody thinks, feels and behaves very differently from most other people in a way that causes them to have serious difficulties in their life and in their relationships with other people
a medical condition in which a woman feels very sad and anxious in the period after her baby is born, and may have negative thoughts or problems dealing with normal life
a medical condition in which a woman feels very sad and anxious in the period after her baby is born, and may have negative thoughts or problems dealing with normal life
a mental illness following a very frightening or shocking experience, which usually involves feeling anxious and depressed and having frightening thoughts

examples.x: treatment for post-traumatic stress disorder
army veterans with post-traumatic stress disorder

senses.definition: relating to psychiatry or to mental illnesses Psychiatric

examples.x: psychiatric disorders
a psychiatric hospital/nurse/patient
psychiatric treatment

senses.definition: a doctor who studies and treats mental illnesses

examples.x: a leading child psychiatrist
the secrets revealed on the psychiatrist’s couch

senses.definition: the study and treatment of mental illnesses

a method of treating somebody who has problems with their mental health by encouraging them to talk about past experiences and feelings, and trying to help them understand fears and feelings that they were not conscious of

using or connected with a method of treating somebody who has problems with their mental health by encouraging them to talk about past experiences and feelings, and trying to help them understand fears and feelings that they were not conscious of

examples.x: a psychoanalytic approach

senses.definition: a person who has a serious personality disorder that means they do not care about other people's feelings, do not feel sorry when they have done something bad, and may want to be violent or cruel towards others
an offensive word for a person who you think is strange and violent or aggressive

a serious personality disorder that means somebody does not care about other people's feelings, does not feel sorry when they have done something bad, and may want to be violent or cruel towards others
a serious mental health condition in which somebody sees or hears things that are not there, or believes things that are not true
caused by stress and worry, rather than by a physical problem such as an infection

examples.x: I began to experience psychosomatic symptoms such as stomach aches and headaches.

senses.definition: connected with the relationship between the mind and the body
the treatment of mental health problems by talking with a therapist (= a person trained to do this)
affected or caused by a serious mental illness, in which somebody sees or hears things that are not there, or believes things that are not true

examples.x: a psychotic disorder/illness
He suffered a psychotic episode two years ago.
a psychotic patient

senses.definition: a person who has psychosis (= a serious mental illness in which somebody sees or hears things that are not there, or believes things that are not true)
post-traumatic stress disorder (= a mental illness following a very frightening or shocking experience, which usually involves feeling anxious and depressed and having frightening thoughts)
a mental illness that causes a strong desire to set fire to things
to leave your job, school, etc.

examples.x: If I don't get more money I'll quit.
He quit in protest over the decision.
He has decided to quit as manager of the team.
to quit your job
He quit the show last year because of bad health.
She quit school at 16.
I am considering quitting my job to start a business.

senses.definition: to stop doing something

examples.x: I've quit teaching.
You don't know me, so quit trying to act like you do.
She finally quit working at age 76.
Just quit it!
We only just started. We're not going to quit now.

senses.definition: to leave the place where you live

examples.x: We decided it was time to quit the city.
The landlord gave them all notice to quit.
I decide to quit town and lie low for a while.

senses.definition: to close a computer program or application

examples.x: I quit the app and restarted it.

senses.definition: a type of psychotherapy that involves making the experience of being born seem to happen again using controlled breathing
the process of treating somebody who has a problem with drugs or alcohol Rehab

examples.x: to go into rehab
a rehab clinic

senses.definition: seasonal affective disorder (= a condition in which a person feels sad and tired during late autumn and winter when there is not much light from the sun)
a mental illness in which a person becomes unable to link thought, emotion and behaviour, leading to withdrawal from reality and personal relationships
a condition in which a person feels sad and tired during late autumn and winter when there is not much light from the sun
to divide body tissue by cutting
to cut animal or plant tissue into thin slices in order to look at it under a microscope
to officially send somebody to a psychiatric hospital, using a law that can force them to stay there to have treatment

examples.x: He was sectioned under the Mental Health Act because he was harming himself.

senses.definition: the practice of deliberately injuring yourself, for example by cutting yourself, as a way to express or try to deal with feeling very unhappy or worried
the act of deliberately injuring yourself, for example by cutting yourself, as a way to express or try to deal with feeling very unhappy or worried
a mental illness caused by fighting in a war
a way of treating a mental illness by giving electric shocks or a drug that has a similar effect
a person who has a personality disorder that means they behave in an aggressive, violent or unpleasant way towards other people
a drug that is used to make people feel less anxious and more relaxed
a specialist who treats a particular type of illness or problem, or who uses a particular type of treatment

examples.x: a speech therapist
a beauty therapist

senses.definition: a person who is trained to treat somebody who has problems with their mental health by talking with them
the treatment of a physical problem or an illness catch

examples.x: He is receiving therapy for cancer.
Most leukaemia patients undergo some sort of drug therapy (= treatment using drugs).
alternative/complementary therapies (= treatments that do not use traditional drugs)
new cancer therapies
They recommend exercise therapy for patients with chronic back pain.

senses.definition: the treatment of problems with somebody's mental health by talking with them

examples.x: She's in therapy.
I went into therapy because my doctor suggested it.
the use of hypnosis as a form of therapy
a therapy group/session

senses.definition: a drug used to reduce anxiety (= worry and stress) Tranquillizer/​tranquilizer

examples.x: She's on (= regularly takes) tranquillizers.

senses.definition: a mental condition caused by severe shock, stress or fear, especially when the harmful effects last for a long time

examples.x: the effects of trauma and stress on the body
The children showed no signs of trauma after their ordeal.
patients who have histories of childhood trauma

senses.definition: a very frightening or upsetting experience

examples.x: She felt exhausted after the traumas of recent weeks.

senses.definition: an injury

examples.x: The patient suffered severe brain trauma.

senses.definition: a drug used to reduce anxiety (= feelings of fear and worry)
